data.name: سُورَةُ المُؤۡمِنُونَ
data.englishBism: In the name of God, The Most Gracious, The Dispenser of Grace

ayahs.englishText: TRULY, to a happy state shall attain the believers:
ayahs.arabicText: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ

ayahs.englishText: those who humble themselves in their prayer,
ayahs.arabicText: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي صَلَاتِهِمْ خَاشِعُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and who turn away from all that is frivolous,
ayahs.arabicText: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ عَنِ اللَّغْوِ مُعْرِضُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and who are intent on inner purity;
ayahs.arabicText: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِلزَّكَاةِ فَاعِلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and who are mindful of their chastity,
ayahs.arabicText: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِفُرُوجِهِمْ حَافِظُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [not giving way to their desires] with any but their spouses - that is, those whom they rightfully possess [through wedlock]: for then, behold, they are free of all blame,
ayahs.arabicText: إِلَّا عَلَىٰ أَزْوَاجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ

ayahs.englishText: whereas such as seek to go beyond that [limit] are truly transgressors;
ayahs.arabicText: فَمَنِ ابْتَغَىٰ وَرَاءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْعَادُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and who are faithful to their trusts and to their pledges,
ayahs.arabicText: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِأَمَانَاتِهِمْ وَعَهْدِهِمْ رَاعُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and who guard their prayers [from all worldly intent].
ayahs.arabicText: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَوَاتِهِمْ يُحَافِظُونَ

ayahs.englishText: It is they, they who shall be the inheritors
ayahs.arabicText: أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْوَارِثُونَ

ayahs.englishText: that will inherit the paradise; [and] therein shall they abide.
ayahs.arabicText: الَّذِينَ يَرِثُونَ الْفِرْدَوْسَ هُمْ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ

ayahs.englishText: NOW, INDEED, We create man out of the essence of clay,
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ مِنْ سُلَالَةٍ مِنْ طِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: and then We cause him to remain as a drop of sperm in [the wombs] firm keeping,
ayahs.arabicText: ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَاهُ نُطْفَةً فِي قَرَارٍ مَكِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: and then We create out of the drop of sperm a germ-cell, and then We create out of the germ-cell an embryonic lump, and then We create within the embryonic lump bones, and then We clothe the bones with flesh - and then We bring [all] this into being as a new creation: hallowed, therefore, is God, the best of artisans!
ayahs.arabicText: ثُمَّ خَلَقْنَا النُّطْفَةَ عَلَقَةً فَخَلَقْنَا الْعَلَقَةَ مُضْغَةً فَخَلَقْنَا الْمُضْغَةَ عِظَامًا فَكَسَوْنَا الْعِظَامَ لَحْمًا ثُمَّ أَنْشَأْنَاهُ خَلْقًا آخَرَ ۚ فَتَبَارَكَ اللَّهُ أَحْسَنُ الْخَالِقِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And then, behold! after all this, you are destined to die;
ayahs.arabicText: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ لَمَيِّتُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and then, behold! you shall be raised from the dead on Resurrection Day.
ayahs.arabicText: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ تُبْعَثُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And, indeed, We have created above you seven [celestial] orbits: and never are We unmindful of [any aspect of Our] creation.
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا فَوْقَكُمْ سَبْعَ طَرَائِقَ وَمَا كُنَّا عَنِ الْخَلْقِ غَافِلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And We send down water from the skies in accordance with a measure [set by Us], and then We cause it to lodge in the earth: but, behold, We are most certainly able to withdraw this [blessing]!
ayahs.arabicText: وَأَنْزَلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً بِقَدَرٍ فَأَسْكَنَّاهُ فِي الْأَرْضِ ۖ وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰ ذَهَابٍ بِهِ لَقَادِرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And by means of this [water] We bring forth for you gardens of date-palms and vines, wherein you have fruit abundant and whereof you eat,
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَنْشَأْنَا لَكُمْ بِهِ جَنَّاتٍ مِنْ نَخِيلٍ وَأَعْنَابٍ لَكُمْ فِيهَا فَوَاكِهُ كَثِيرَةٌ وَمِنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: as well as a tree that issues from [the lands adjoining] Mount Sinai, yielding oil and relish for all to eat.
ayahs.arabicText: وَشَجَرَةً تَخْرُجُ مِنْ طُورِ سَيْنَاءَ تَنْبُتُ بِالدُّهْنِ وَصِبْغٍ لِلْآكِلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And, behold, in the cattle [too] there is indeed a lesson for you: We give you to drink of that [milk] which is within their bellies; and you derive many [other] uses from them: for, you eat of their flesh,
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنَّ لَكُمْ فِي الْأَنْعَامِ لَعِبْرَةً ۖ نُسْقِيكُمْ مِمَّا فِي بُطُونِهَا وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا مَنَافِعُ كَثِيرَةٌ وَمِنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and by them - as by the ships [over the sea] - you are borne [overland].
ayahs.arabicText: وَعَلَيْهَا وَعَلَى الْفُلْكِ تُحْمَلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: AND, INDEED, We sent forth Noah unto his people and he said: “O my people! Worship God alone]: you have no deity other than Him. Will you not, then, become conscious of Him?”
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ فَقَالَ يَا قَوْمِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مَا لَكُمْ مِنْ إِلَٰهٍ غَيْرُهُ ۖ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: But the great ones among his people, who refused to acknowledge the truth, replied: “This [man] is nothing but a mortal like yourselves who wants to make himself superior to you! For, if God had willed [to convey a message unto us], He would surely have sent down angels; [moreover,] we have never heard [any­thing like] this from our forebears of old!
ayahs.arabicText: فَقَالَ الْمَلَأُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ قَوْمِهِ مَا هَٰذَا إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُكُمْ يُرِيدُ أَنْ يَتَفَضَّلَ عَلَيْكُمْ وَلَوْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ لَأَنْزَلَ مَلَائِكَةً مَا سَمِعْنَا بِهَٰذَا فِي آبَائِنَا الْأَوَّلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: He is nothing but a madman: so bear with him for a while.”
ayahs.arabicText: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا رَجُلٌ بِهِ جِنَّةٌ فَتَرَبَّصُوا بِهِ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: Said [Noah]: “O my Sustainer! Succour me against their accusation of lying!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ انْصُرْنِي بِمَا كَذَّبُونِ

ayahs.englishText: Thereupon We inspired him thus: “Build, un­der Our eyes and according to Our inspiration, the ark [that shall save thee and those who follow thee]. And when Our judgment comes to pass, and waters gush forth in torrents over the face of the earth, place on board of this [ark] one pair of each [kind of animal] of either sex, as well as thy family - excepting those on whom sentence has already been passed; and do not appeal to Me [any more] in behalf of those who are bent on evildoing - for, behold, they are destined to be drowned!
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْهِ أَنِ اصْنَعِ الْفُلْكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا وَوَحْيِنَا فَإِذَا جَاءَ أَمْرُنَا وَفَارَ التَّنُّورُ ۙ فَاسْلُكْ فِيهَا مِنْ كُلٍّ زَوْجَيْنِ اثْنَيْنِ وَأَهْلَكَ إِلَّا مَنْ سَبَقَ عَلَيْهِ الْقَوْلُ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَلَا تُخَاطِبْنِي فِي الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا ۖ إِنَّهُمْ مُغْرَقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: “And as soon as thou and those who are with thee are settled in the ark, say: ‘All praise is due to God, who has saved us from those evildoing folk!’
ayahs.arabicText: فَإِذَا اسْتَوَيْتَ أَنْتَ وَمَنْ مَعَكَ عَلَى الْفُلْكِ فَقُلِ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي نَجَّانَا مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: “And say: ‘O my Sustainer! Cause me to reach a destination blessed [by Thee] for Thou art the best to show man how to reach his [true] destination!’”
ayahs.arabicText: وَقُلْ رَبِّ أَنْزِلْنِي مُنْزَلًا مُبَارَكًا وَأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الْمُنْزِلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: In this [story], behold, there are messages indeed [for those who think]: for, verily, We always put [man] to a test.
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ وَإِنْ كُنَّا لَمُبْتَلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: AND AFTER those [people of old] We gave rise to new generations;
ayahs.arabicText: ثُمَّ أَنْشَأْنَا مِنْ بَعْدِهِمْ قَرْنًا آخَرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and [every time] We sent unto them an apostle from among themselves, [he told them:] “Worship God [alone]: you have no deity other than Him. Will you not, then, become conscious of Him?”
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَرْسَلْنَا فِيهِمْ رَسُولًا مِنْهُمْ أَنِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مَا لَكُمْ مِنْ إِلَٰهٍ غَيْرُهُ ۖ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And [every time] the great ones among his people, who refused to acknowledge the truth and gave the lie to the announcement of a life to come - [simply] because We had granted them ease and plenty in [their] worldly life, and they had become corrupted by it [every time] they would say: “This [man] is nothing hut a mortal like yourselves, eating of what you eat, and drinking of what you drink:
ayahs.arabicText: وَقَالَ الْمَلَأُ مِنْ قَوْمِهِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَكَذَّبُوا بِلِقَاءِ الْآخِرَةِ وَأَتْرَفْنَاهُمْ فِي الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا مَا هَٰذَا إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُكُمْ يَأْكُلُ مِمَّا تَأْكُلُونَ مِنْهُ وَيَشْرَبُ مِمَّا تَشْرَبُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and, indeed, if you pay heed to a mortal like your­selves, you will surely be the losers!
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَئِنْ أَطَعْتُمْ بَشَرًا مِثْلَكُمْ إِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَخَاسِرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Does he promise you that, after you have died and become [mere] dust and bones, you shall be brought forth [to a new life]?
ayahs.arabicText: أَيَعِدُكُمْ أَنَّكُمْ إِذَا مِتُّمْ وَكُنْتُمْ تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَنَّكُمْ مُخْرَجُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Far-fetched, far-fetched indeed is what you are promised!
ayahs.arabicText: ۞ هَيْهَاتَ هَيْهَاتَ لِمَا تُوعَدُونَ

ayahs.englishText: There is no life beyond our life in this world: we die and we live [but once], and we shall never be raised from the dead!
ayahs.arabicText: إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا حَيَاتُنَا الدُّنْيَا نَمُوتُ وَنَحْيَا وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَبْعُوثِينَ

ayahs.englishText: He is nothing but a man who attributes his own lying in­ventions to God, and we are not going to believe him!”
ayahs.arabicText: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا رَجُلٌ افْتَرَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا وَمَا نَحْنُ لَهُ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [Whereupon the prophet] would say: “O my Sustainer! Succour me against their accusation of lying!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ انْصُرْنِي بِمَا كَذَّبُونِ

ayahs.englishText: [And God] would say: “After a little while they will surely be smitten with remorse!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ عَمَّا قَلِيلٍ لَيُصْبِحُنَّ نَادِمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And then the blast [of Our punishment] over­took them, justly and unavoidably, and We caused them to become as the flotsam of dead leaves and the scum borne on the surface of a torrent: and so - away with those evildoing folk!
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّيْحَةُ بِالْحَقِّ فَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ غُثَاءً ۚ فَبُعْدًا لِلْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: AND AFTER them We gave rise to new genera­tions:
ayahs.arabicText: ثُمَّ أَنْشَأْنَا مِنْ بَعْدِهِمْ قُرُونًا آخَرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [for,] no community can ever forestall [the end of] its term - and neither can they delay [its coming].
ayahs.arabicText: مَا تَسْبِقُ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسْتَأْخِرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And We sent forth Our apostles, one after another: [and] every time their apostle came to a community, they gave him the lie: and so We caused them to follow one another [into the grave], and let them become [mere] tales: and so - away with the folk who would not believe!
ayahs.arabicText: ثُمَّ أَرْسَلْنَا رُسُلَنَا تَتْرَىٰ ۖ كُلَّ مَا جَاءَ أُمَّةً رَسُولُهَا كَذَّبُوهُ ۚ فَأَتْبَعْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ بَعْضًا وَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ أَحَادِيثَ ۚ فَبُعْدًا لِقَوْمٍ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ

ayahs.englishText: AND THEN We sent forth Moses and his brother Aaron with Our messages and a manifest authority [from Us]
ayahs.arabicText: ثُمَّ أَرْسَلْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَأَخَاهُ هَارُونَ بِآيَاتِنَا وَسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: unto Pharaoh and his great ones; but these behaved with arrogance, for they were people wont to glorify [only] themselves.
ayahs.arabicText: إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَئِهِ فَاسْتَكْبَرُوا وَكَانُوا قَوْمًا عَالِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And so they said: “Shall we believe [them] two mortals like ourselves - although their people are our slaves?”
ayahs.arabicText: فَقَالُوا أَنُؤْمِنُ لِبَشَرَيْنِ مِثْلِنَا وَقَوْمُهُمَا لَنَا عَابِدُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Thus, they gave the lie to those two, and earned (thereby) their place among the doomed:
ayahs.arabicText: فَكَذَّبُوهُمَا فَكَانُوا مِنَ الْمُهْلَكِينَ

ayahs.englishText: for, indeed, We had vouchsafed revelation unto Moses in order that they might find the right way.
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى الْكِتَابَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَهْتَدُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And [as We exalted Moses, so, too,] We made the son of Mary and his mother a symbol [of Our grace], and provided for both an abode in a lofty place of lasting restfulness and unsullied springs.
ayahs.arabicText: وَجَعَلْنَا ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ وَأُمَّهُ آيَةً وَآوَيْنَاهُمَا إِلَىٰ رَبْوَةٍ ذَاتِ قَرَارٍ وَمَعِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: O YOU APOSTLES! Partake of the good things of life, and do righteous deeds: verily, I have full knowledge of all that you do.
ayahs.arabicText: يَا أَيُّهَا الرُّسُلُ كُلُوا مِنَ الطَّيِّبَاتِ وَاعْمَلُوا صَالِحًا ۖ إِنِّي بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ عَلِيمٌ

ayahs.englishText: And, verily, this community of yours is one single community, since I am the Sustainer of you all: remain, then, conscious of Me!
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنَّ هَٰذِهِ أُمَّتُكُمْ أُمَّةً وَاحِدَةً وَأَنَا رَبُّكُمْ فَاتَّقُونِ

ayahs.englishText: But they (who claim to follow you) have torn their unity wide asunder, piece by piece, each group delighting in [but] what they themselves possess [by way of tenets].
ayahs.arabicText: فَتَقَطَّعُوا أَمْرَهُمْ بَيْنَهُمْ زُبُرًا ۖ كُلُّ حِزْبٍ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ فَرِحُونَ

ayahs.englishText: But leave them alone, lost in their ignorance, until a [future] time.
ayahs.arabicText: فَذَرْهُمْ فِي غَمْرَتِهِمْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: Do they think that by all the wealth and offspring with which We provide them
ayahs.arabicText: أَيَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّمَا نُمِدُّهُمْ بِهِ مِنْ مَالٍ وَبَنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: We [but want to] make them vie with one another in doing [what they consider] good works? Nay, but they do not perceive [their error]!
ayahs.arabicText: نُسَارِعُ لَهُمْ فِي الْخَيْرَاتِ ۚ بَلْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Verily, [only] they who stand in reverent awe of their Sustainer,
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ هُمْ مِنْ خَشْيَةِ رَبِّهِمْ مُشْفِقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and who believe in their Sus­tainer’s messages,
ayahs.arabicText: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ يُؤْمِنُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and who do not ascribe divinity to aught but their Sustainer,
ayahs.arabicText: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ بِرَبِّهِمْ لَا يُشْرِكُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and who give whatever they [have to] give with their hearts trembling at the thought that unto their Sustainer they must return:
ayahs.arabicText: وَالَّذِينَ يُؤْتُونَ مَا آتَوْا وَقُلُوبُهُمْ وَجِلَةٌ أَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ رَاجِعُونَ

ayahs.englishText: it is they who vie with one another in doing good works, and it is they who outrun [all others] in attaining to them!
ayahs.arabicText: أُولَٰئِكَ يُسَارِعُونَ فِي الْخَيْرَاتِ وَهُمْ لَهَا سَابِقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And [withal.] We do not burden any human being with more than he is well able to bear: for with Us is a record that speaks the truth [about what men do and can do]; and none shall be wronged.
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَا نُكَلِّفُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ۖ وَلَدَيْنَا كِتَابٌ يَنْطِقُ بِالْحَقِّ ۚ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ

ayahs.englishText: NAY, [as for those who have torn asunder the unity of faith] - their hearts are lost in ignorance of all this! But apart from that [breach of unity] they have [on their conscience even worse] deeds; and they will [continue to] commit them
ayahs.arabicText: بَلْ قُلُوبُهُمْ فِي غَمْرَةٍ مِنْ هَٰذَا وَلَهُمْ أَعْمَالٌ مِنْ دُونِ ذَٰلِكَ هُمْ لَهَا عَامِلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: until - after We shall have taken to task, through suffering, those from among them who [now] are lost in the pursuit of pleasures - they cry out in [belated] supplication.
ayahs.arabicText: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا أَخَذْنَا مُتْرَفِيهِمْ بِالْعَذَابِ إِذَا هُمْ يَجْأَرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [But they will be told:] “Cry not in supplication today: for, behold, you shall not he succoured by Us!
ayahs.arabicText: لَا تَجْأَرُوا الْيَوْمَ ۖ إِنَّكُمْ مِنَّا لَا تُنْصَرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Time and again were My messages conveyed unto you, but [every time] you would turn about on your heels
ayahs.arabicText: قَدْ كَانَتْ آيَاتِي تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَكُنْتُمْ عَلَىٰ أَعْقَابِكُمْ تَنْكِصُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [and,] impelled by your arrogance, you would talk senselessly far into the night.”
ayahs.arabicText: مُسْتَكْبِرِينَ بِهِ سَامِرًا تَهْجُرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Have they, then, never tried to understand this word [of God]? Or has there [now] come to them something that never came to their forefathers of old?
ayahs.arabicText: أَفَلَمْ يَدَّبَّرُوا الْقَوْلَ أَمْ جَاءَهُمْ مَا لَمْ يَأْتِ آبَاءَهُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Or is it, perchance, that they have not recog­nized their Apostle, and so they disavow him?
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ لَمْ يَعْرِفُوا رَسُولَهُمْ فَهُمْ لَهُ مُنْكِرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Or do they say. “There is madness in him”? Nay, he has brought them the truth - and the truth do most of them detest!
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ بِهِ جِنَّةٌ ۚ بَلْ جَاءَهُمْ بِالْحَقِّ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ لِلْحَقِّ كَارِهُونَ

ayahs.englishText: But if the truth were in accord with their own likes and dislikes, the heavens and the earth would surely have fallen into ruin, and all that lives in them [would long ago have perished]! Nay, [in this divine writ] We have conveyed unto them all that they ought to bear in mind: and from this their reminder they [heedlessly] turn away!
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَوِ اتَّبَعَ الْحَقُّ أَهْوَاءَهُمْ لَفَسَدَتِ السَّمَاوَاتُ وَالْأَرْضُ وَمَنْ فِيهِنَّ ۚ بَلْ أَتَيْنَاهُمْ بِذِكْرِهِمْ فَهُمْ عَنْ ذِكْرِهِمْ مُعْرِضُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Or dost thou [O Muhammad] ask of them any worldly recompense? But [they ought to know that] recompense from thy Sustainer is best, since He is the best of providers!
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ خَرْجًا فَخَرَاجُ رَبِّكَ خَيْرٌ ۖ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ الرَّازِقِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And, verily, thou callest them onto a straight way –
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنَّكَ لَتَدْعُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ

ayahs.englishText: but, behold, those who will not believe in the life to come are bound to deviate from that way.
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنَّ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ عَنِ الصِّرَاطِ لَنَاكِبُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And even were We to show them mercy and remove whatever distress might befall them [in this life], they would still persist in their overweening arrogance, blindly stumbling to and fro.
ayahs.arabicText: ۞ وَلَوْ رَحِمْنَاهُمْ وَكَشَفْنَا مَا بِهِمْ مِنْ ضُرٍّ لَلَجُّوا فِي طُغْيَانِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And, indeed, We tested them through suffer­ing, but they did not abase themselves before their Sustainer; and they will never humble them­selves
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَخَذْنَاهُمْ بِالْعَذَابِ فَمَا اسْتَكَانُوا لِرَبِّهِمْ وَمَا يَتَضَرَّعُونَ

ayahs.englishText: until We open before them a gate of [truly] severe suffering [in the life to come]: and then, lo! they will be broken in spirit.
ayahs.arabicText: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ بَابًا ذَا عَذَابٍ شَدِيدٍ إِذَا هُمْ فِيهِ مُبْلِسُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [O MEN! Pay heed to God’s messages,] for it is He who has endowed you with hearing, and sight, and minds: [yet] how seldom are you grateful!
ayahs.arabicText: وَهُوَ الَّذِي أَنْشَأَ لَكُمُ السَّمْعَ وَالْأَبْصَارَ وَالْأَفْئِدَةَ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَا تَشْكُرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And He it is who has caused you to multiply on earth; and unto Him you shall be gathered.
ayahs.arabicText: وَهُوَ الَّذِي ذَرَأَكُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And He it is who grants life and deals death; and to Him is due the alternation of night and day. Will you not, then, use your reason?
ayahs.arabicText: وَهُوَ الَّذِي يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ وَلَهُ اخْتِلَافُ اللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: But nay, they speak as the people of olden times did speak:
ayahs.arabicText: بَلْ قَالُوا مِثْلَ مَا قَالَ الْأَوَّلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: they say: “What! After we have died and become mere dust and bones, shall we, forsooth, be raised from the dead?
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Indeed, this [very thing] we have been promised - we and our forefathers - long ago! This is nothing but fables of ancient times!”
ayahs.arabicText: لَقَدْ وُعِدْنَا نَحْنُ وَآبَاؤُنَا هَٰذَا مِنْ قَبْلُ إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Say: “Unto whom belongs the earth and all that lives there on? [Tell me this] if you happen to know [the answer]!”
ayahs.arabicText: قُلْ لِمَنِ الْأَرْضُ وَمَنْ فِيهَا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [And they will reply: “Unto God.” Say: “Will you not, then, bethink yourselves [of Him]?”
ayahs.arabicText: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُلْ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Say: “Who is it that sustains the seven heavens and is enthroned in His awesome almightiness?”
ayahs.arabicText: قُلْ مَنْ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ السَّبْعِ وَرَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ

ayahs.englishText: [And] they will reply: “[All this power belongs] to God.” Say: “Will you not, then, remain conscious of Him?”
ayahs.arabicText: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُلْ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Say: “In whose hand rests the mighty dominion over all things, and who is it that protects, the while there is no protection against Him? [Tell me this] if you happen to know [the answer]!”
ayahs.arabicText: قُلْ مَنْ بِيَدِهِ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَهُوَ يُجِيرُ وَلَا يُجَارُ عَلَيْهِ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [And] they will reply: “[All this power belongs] to God.” Say: ‘How, then, can you be so deluded?”
ayahs.arabicText: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُلْ فَأَنَّىٰ تُسْحَرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Nay, We have conveyed unto them the truth: and yet, behold, they are intent on lying [to them­selves]!
ayahs.arabicText: بَلْ أَتَيْنَاهُمْ بِالْحَقِّ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَكَاذِبُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Never did God take unto Himself any offspring, nor has there ever been any deity side by side with Him: [for, had there been any,] lo! each deity would surely have stood apart [from the others] in whatever it had created, and they would surely have [tried to] overcome one another! Limitless in His glory is God, [far] above anything that men may devise by way of definition,
ayahs.arabicText: مَا اتَّخَذَ اللَّهُ مِنْ وَلَدٍ وَمَا كَانَ مَعَهُ مِنْ إِلَٰهٍ ۚ إِذًا لَذَهَبَ كُلُّ إِلَٰهٍ بِمَا خَلَقَ وَلَعَلَا بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ ۚ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ

ayahs.englishText: knowing all that is beyond the reach of a created being’s perception as well as all that can be witnessed by a creature’s senses or mind and, hence, sublimely exalted is He above anything to which they may ascribe a share in His divinity!
ayahs.arabicText: عَالِمِ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ فَتَعَالَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ

ayahs.englishText: SAY: “O my Sustainer! If it be Thy will to let me witness [the fulfillment of] whatever they [who blaspheme against Thee] have been promised [to suffer] –
ayahs.arabicText: قُلْ رَبِّ إِمَّا تُرِيَنِّي مَا يُوعَدُونَ

ayahs.englishText: do not, O my Sustainer, let me be one of those evildoing folk!”
ayahs.arabicText: رَبِّ فَلَا تَجْعَلْنِي فِي الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [Pray thus] for, behold, We are most cer­tainly able to let thee witness [the fulfillment, even in this world, of] whatever We promise them!
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰ أَنْ نُرِيَكَ مَا نَعِدُهُمْ لَقَادِرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [But whatever they may say or do,] repel the evil [which they commit] with something that is bet­ter: We are fully aware of what they attribute [to Us].
ayahs.arabicText: ادْفَعْ بِالَّتِي هِيَ أَحْسَنُ السَّيِّئَةَ ۚ نَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَصِفُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And say: “O my Sustainer! I seek refuge with Thee from the promptings of all evil impulses;
ayahs.arabicText: وَقُلْ رَبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ هَمَزَاتِ الشَّيَاطِينِ

ayahs.englishText: and I seek refuge with Thee, O my Sustainer, lest they come near unto me!’
ayahs.arabicText: وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ رَبِّ أَنْ يَحْضُرُونِ

ayahs.englishText: [AS FOR THOSE who will not believe in the life to come, they go on lying to themselves] until, when death approaches any of them, he prays: “O my Sustainer! Let me return, let me return [to life],
ayahs.arabicText: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَاءَ أَحَدَهُمُ الْمَوْتُ قَالَ رَبِّ ارْجِعُونِ

ayahs.englishText: so that I might act righteously in whatever I have failed [aforetime]!” Nay, it is indeed but a [meaningless] word that he utters: for behind those [who leave the world] there is a barrier [of death] until the Day when all will be raised from the dead!
ayahs.arabicText: لَعَلِّي أَعْمَلُ صَالِحًا فِيمَا تَرَكْتُ ۚ كَلَّا ۚ إِنَّهَا كَلِمَةٌ هُوَ قَائِلُهَا ۖ وَمِنْ وَرَائِهِمْ بَرْزَخٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Then, when the trumpet [of resurrection] is blown, no ties of kinship will on that Day prevail among them, and neither will they ask about one another.
ayahs.arabicText: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ فَلَا أَنْسَابَ بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَلَا يَتَسَاءَلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And they whose weight [of righteousness] is heavy in the balance - it is they, they who will have attained to a happy state;
ayahs.arabicText: فَمَنْ ثَقُلَتْ مَوَازِينُهُ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ

ayahs.englishText: whereas they whose weight is light in the balance - it is they who will have squandered their own selves, [destined] to abide in hell:
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَنْ خَفَّتْ مَوَازِينُهُ فَأُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ خَسِرُوا أَنْفُسَهُمْ فِي جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدُونَ

ayahs.englishText: the fire will scorch their faces, and they will abide therein with their lips distorted in pain.
ayahs.arabicText: تَلْفَحُ وُجُوهَهُمُ النَّارُ وَهُمْ فِيهَا كَالِحُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [And God will say:] “Were not My messages conveyed unto you, and were you [not] wont to give them the lie?”
ayahs.arabicText: أَلَمْ تَكُنْ آيَاتِي تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَكُنْتُمْ بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ

ayahs.englishText: They will exclaim: “O our Sustainer! Our bad luck has overwhelmed us, and so we went astray!
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا رَبَّنَا غَلَبَتْ عَلَيْنَا شِقْوَتُنَا وَكُنَّا قَوْمًا ضَالِّينَ

ayahs.englishText: O our Sustainer! Cause us to come out of this [suffering] - and then, if ever We revert [to sinning], may we truly be [deemed] evildoers!”
ayahs.arabicText: رَبَّنَا أَخْرِجْنَا مِنْهَا فَإِنْ عُدْنَا فَإِنَّا ظَالِمُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [But] He will say: “Away with you into this [ignominy]! And speak no more unto Me!
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ اخْسَئُوا فِيهَا وَلَا تُكَلِّمُونِ

ayahs.englishText: “Behold, there were among My servants such as would pray, ‘O our Sustainer! We have come to believe [in Thee]; forgive, then, our sins and bestow Thy mercy on us: for Thou art the truest bestower of mercy!’
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّهُ كَانَ فَرِيقٌ مِنْ عِبَادِي يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا آمَنَّا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا وَارْحَمْنَا وَأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الرَّاحِمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: - but you made them a target of your derision to the point where it made you forget all remembrance of Me; and you went on and on laugh­ing at them.
ayahs.arabicText: فَاتَّخَذْتُمُوهُمْ سِخْرِيًّا حَتَّىٰ أَنْسَوْكُمْ ذِكْرِي وَكُنْتُمْ مِنْهُمْ تَضْحَكُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [But,] behold, today I have rewarded them for their patience in adversity: verily, it is they, they who have achieved a triumph!”
ayahs.arabicText: إِنِّي جَزَيْتُهُمُ الْيَوْمَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا أَنَّهُمْ هُمُ الْفَائِزُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [And] He will ask [the doomed]: “What number of years have you spent on earth?”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ كَمْ لَبِثْتُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ عَدَدَ سِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: They will answer: ‘We have spent there a day, or part of a day; but ask those who [are able to] count [time] …”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا لَبِثْنَا يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍ فَاسْأَلِ الْعَادِّينَ

ayahs.englishText: [Whereupon] He will say: “You have spent there but a short while: had you but known [how short it was to be]!
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ إِنْ لَبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا ۖ لَوْ أَنَّكُمْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Did you, then, think that We created you in mere idle play, and that you would not have to return to Us?”
ayahs.arabicText: أَفَحَسِبْتُمْ أَنَّمَا خَلَقْنَاكُمْ عَبَثًا وَأَنَّكُمْ إِلَيْنَا لَا تُرْجَعُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [KNOW,] then, [that] God is sublimely exalted, the Ultimate Sovereign, the Ultimate Truth: there is no deity save Him, the Sustainer, in bountiful almightiness enthroned!
ayahs.arabicText: فَتَعَالَى اللَّهُ الْمَلِكُ الْحَقُّ ۖ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْكَرِيمِ

ayahs.englishText: Hence, he who invokes, side by side with God, any other deity [- a deity] for whose existence he has no evidence - shall but find his reckoning with his Sustainer: [and,] verily, such deniers of the truth will never attain to a happy state!
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَنْ يَدْعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ لَا بُرْهَانَ لَهُ بِهِ فَإِنَّمَا حِسَابُهُ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ لَا يُفْلِحُ الْكَافِرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Hence, [O believer,] say: “O my Sustainer! Grant [me] forgiveness and bestow Thy mercy [upon me]: for Thou art the truest bestower of mercy!”
ayahs.arabicText: وَقُلْ رَبِّ اغْفِرْ وَارْحَمْ وَأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الرَّاحِمِينَ
